greek_influence.name: Pharos Lighthouse
greek_influence.description: One of the Seven Wonders. A massive lighthouse built on the island of Pharos, guiding ships into Alexandria’s harbor.

greek_influence.name: Canopus
greek_influence.description: Greek Hellenistic & Religious Influence. A hub of Greek settlement and the cult of Serapis, a deity combining Greek and Egyptian religious elements.

greek_influence.name: Memphis
greek_influence.description: Religious & Administrative Center. While Alexandria became the capital, Memphis remained an important religious and administrative center under Greek rule.

greek_influence.name: Naukratis
greek_influence.description: The First Greek Colony in Egypt. A Greek trading post established in the 7th century BCE, serving as a cultural and commercial bridge between Greece and Egypt.

greek_influence.name: Temple of Horus at Edfu
greek_influence.description: Greek-Egyptian Architecture. Built under Ptolemaic rule, this temple blended Greek and Egyptian architectural styles while honoring Egyptian deities.

greek_influence.name: Kom Ombo
greek_influence.description: Temple of Sobek & Haroeris. A unique double temple built during the Ptolemaic period, dedicated to both the crocodile god Sobek and the falcon god Haroeris.

greek_influence.name: Athens
greek_influence.description: Egyptian Influence in Classical Greece. Egyptian religion and knowledge influenced Greek thought, with temples to Isis and Serapis appearing in Athens.

greek_influence.name: Delos
greek_influence.description: The Island of Egyptian Gods. A major religious and trade hub, Delos had temples dedicated to Isis and Serapis, showing Egypt’s influence in the Aegean.

greek_influence.name: Rhodes
greek_influence.description: The Ptolemaic Naval Base. A key ally of Ptolemaic Egypt, Rhodes housed Egyptian-funded projects and was crucial in Mediterranean trade.

greek_influence.name: Pergamon
greek_influence.description: Intellectual Rival to Alexandria. The Library of Pergamon was a rival to Alexandria’s Great Library, leading to competition in scholarship and manuscript production.

greek_influence.name: Rome
greek_influence.description: The Egyptian Obelisks & Temples. After the conquest of Egypt in 30 BCE, Rome absorbed its wealth, culture, and even obelisks, placing them in public spaces.

greek_influence.name: Naples
greek_influence.description: The Egyptian Cult in Southern Italy. Naples had a strong cult of Isis, with Egyptian-style temples and iconography influencing Roman religious practices.

greek_influence.name: Cumae
greek_influence.description: Oracle Linked to Egyptian Mysticism. The Sibyl of Cumae, a prophetess in Roman mythology, was believed to be influenced by Egyptian mystical traditions.

greek_influence.name: Seis
greek_influence.description: Temple of Neith, Egypt. Plato wrote that Egyptian priests in Sais told Solon the story of Atlantis.

greek_influence.name: Richat Structure
greek_influence.description: Speculated as Plato’s Atlantis due to its circular structure and location.

greek_influence.name: Herakleion & Thonis
greek_influence.description: Ancient Egyptian port city, sunken in the Mediterranean, where Greek and Egyptian cultures met.

greek_influence.name: Tartessos
greek_influence.description: Ancient Iberian Civilization. A lost civilization mentioned by the Greeks, sometimes linked to Atlantis.

greek_influence.name: Jebel Musa
greek_influence.description: Pillar of Hercules, Morocco. Ancient writers believed Atlantis lay beyond these pillars, linking them to Plato’s legend.

greek_influence.name: Rock of Gibraltar
greek_influence.description: The Myth of Hercules & the Pillars of Hercules. In Greek mythology, Hercules separated these two mountains to create the Strait of Gibraltar.

greek_influence.name: Atlas Mountains
greek_influence.description: In Greek mythology, Atlas was condemned to hold up the sky and was linked to a great land named Atlantis. The mountains were named after him, and some theories suggest Atlantis was located nearby.

greek_influence.name: Phoenician Lixus, Morocco
greek_influence.description: Possible Atlantis location.

greek_influence.name: Madeira
greek_influence.description: Some historians believe Greek myths of western lands were inspired by Egyptian & Phoenician maps.
